meanings.sent1: She blubbed when she dropped her ice cream.
meanings.sent2: The baby blubbed loudly when he lost his favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The clown blubbed during the funny movie.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds blubbed tears of rain onto the earth.
meanings.sent5: The sad movie made her blub with emotion.

meanings.definition: To cry in a noisy and uncontrollable way.
meanings.sent1: He blubbed after stubbing his toe on the table.
meanings.sent2: The child blubbed when he couldn't find his teddy bear.
meanings.sent3: The cat blubbed after getting stuck in a tree.
meanings.sent4: The river blubbed as it flowed swiftly downstream.
meanings.sent5: The old man blubbed with joy at the surprise party.
